page.title: 11Attitudes at the School
page.content: As may be seen the aim of the school is to ensure that all children have access to a wide curriculum and great emphasis is placed on the children using and experiencing their own environment. One project, the development by pupils of a school garden, has given them the opportunity to watch the changing seasons. The resulting pride in their acheivement has in turn created a caring attitude towards their environment which it is hoped will extend beyond the school community. The caring attitude prevalent in this school is typified by one lady employed to work in the kitchen, but who is often to be found helping the children with their garden.
